title: Looking for a wedding ring font
content:
We're getting our wedding rings hand-engraved, and our engraver tells us that we can pick any typeface we like.

So which one would you recommend?

[Here are some](http://web.archive.org/web/20100201041405/http:/blah.nu/files/rings.pdf) that came off the top of my head.
author: tic

comments.content: [High Elvish](http://web.archive.org/web/20100201041405/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:OneTrueRing.JPG) because a bit of magic will help.
I actually quite like Adobe Garamond Pro Italic. It has, in my opinion, an unexpected elegance. Apart from that maybe Bembo or Caslon.

I don’t think a classical lead typeface (Garamond, Bembo …) suits best for engraving. It should be a typeface which has something engraving-like in the very nature of its style.  
Of the well-known this could be something like Didot or a classical script face. If you’re looking for something more fancy, look at  
 [http://typophile.com/node/58746](http://web.archive.org/web/20100201041405/http:/typophile.com/node/58746 "http://typophile.com/node/58746")  
– its perfect for engraving (and all your other wedding stationary).

Ah, above all: \* B E S T \_ W I S H E S \*

\> our engraver tells us that we can pick any typeface we like

Lucky you! I was presented with the following five choices:

- Times New Roman
- Arial Bold Italic
- Mistral
- Bernhard Fashion
- Shelley Allegro
